content.text: Write in figures the number one hundred and twenty one thousand and forty two
Write down the number of centimetres in \(2\frac{1}{2}\) metres
Work out 72 cents as a percentage of 83 cents
Write 41 524 correct to the nearest thousand
One quarter of the 41 524 people left before the end of the game
Find the number of people who left before the end of the game
There were 41 524 people at a football match
Write down the order of rotational symmetry of this shape
Draw the lines of symmetry on this shape
Write down the co-ordinates of point \(A\)
On the grid, plot the point \((-1, 3)\)
Give your answer correct to 4 significant figures
Yim knows one angle of an isosceles triangle is \(48^{\circ}\)
He says one of the other angles **must** be \(66^{\circ}\)
Write down the probability that the letter is S
The letter is replaced and again a letter is taken at random
How many times would you expect the letter to be S?
One of the 6 letters is taken at random
The length, \(p \mathrm{cm}\), of a car is \(440 \mathrm{cm}\), correct to the nearest \(10 \mathrm{cm}\)
Bruce invested \(800 at a rate of 3\%\) per year simple interest
Calculate the **total** amount he has after 6 years
On the diagram above, draw a line perpendicular to the line \(AB\), through the point \(P\)
Using a straight edge and compasses only, construct the locus of points that are equidistant from \(A\) and from \(C\)
The diagram shows a ladder of length \(8\mathrm{m}\) leaning against a vertical wall
Give your answer correct to 2 significant figures
Do not use a calculator in this question and show all the steps of your working
Give each answer as a fraction in its lowest terms
Rearrange the following formula to make \(m\) the subject
Write down the next term in the sequence
Explain how you worked out your answer to part (a)(i)
Here are the first four terms of a sequence
The \(n\) th term of a different sequence is \(4n - 2\)
Write down the first three terms of this sequence
Here are the first four terms of another sequence
Write down the \(n\) th term of this sequence
